IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: APPLESEED IS THE FOUNDER OF, AND THE NATIONAL OFFICE FOR, A NON-PROFIT NETWORK OF 18 CENTERS ACROSS THE U.S. AND MEXICO. APPLESEED IS DEDICATED TO ADVANCING JUSTICE AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT HELP LOW-INCOME PEOPLE AND WORKING FAMILIES BUILD BETTER LIVES. APPLESEED EMPLOYS LITIGATION, POLICY ADVOCACY, AND GRASS ROOTS ORGANIZING, AND MAKES A DIFFERENCE BY STAYING CLOSE TO THEIRCOMMUNITIES, WINNING VICTORIES IN HARD POLITICAL ENVIRONMENTS, AND BRINGING THE POWER AND EXPERTISE OF A NATIONAL NETWORK TO BEAR ON CROSS-CUTTING SOCIAL ISSUES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: APPLESEED IS THE FOUNDER OF, AND THE NATIONAL OFFICE FOR, A NON-PROFIT NETWORK OF 18 CENTERS ACROSS THE U.S. AND MEXICO, DEDICATED TO ADVANCING JUSTICE AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT HELP LOW-INCOME PEOPLE AND WORKING FAMILIES BUILD BETTER LIVES.
IRS990.Desc: FIELD NETWORK - APPLESEED PROVIDES SUPPORT TO LOCAL, INDEPENDENT APPLESEED CENTERS WHICH EXPOSE AND AMELIORATE INJUSTICES AND ELIMINATE BARRIERS TO OPPORTUNITY AND STRENGTHEN CIVIL SOCIETY BY ENGAGINGLEADERS IN THE ONGOING WORK OF BUILDING JUSTICE AND COMMUNITY. APPLESEED BUILDS CONNECTIONS AMONG LEADERS OF APPLESEED CENTERS, ELEVATES "BEST PRACTICES", AND VERIFIES THAT CENTERS ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE STANDARDS OF AFFILIATION.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: COLLABORATIVE PROJECTS AND PRO BONO LEGAL SERVICES - APPLESEED ORGANIZES AND ESTABLISHES APPLESEED CENTERS AND PROVIDES SUPPORT TO NEW AND ESTABLISHED CENTERS THROUGH A VARIETY OF MEANS, INCLUDING PROJECT CONSULTATION AND COORDINATION, MOVING LOCAL PROJECTS TO THE NATIONAL STAGE, PARTICIPATING IN NATIONAL COALITIONS, AND FUNDING FOR COLLABORATIVE PROJECTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: COMMUNICATIONS - APPLESEED INFORMS OPINION LEADERS, POLICYMAKERS, THE MEDIA, ITS STAFF AND SUPPORTERS, AND MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC ABOUT ITS RESEARCH, ADVOCACY CAMPAIGNS AND ACCOMPLISHMENTS. APPLESEED'S COMMUNICATION TOOLS INCLUDE ITS ONLINE NEWSLETTER, A REGULARLY UPDATED WEBSITE, DISTRIBUTION OF PUBLICATIONS AND OTHER SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS. APPLESEED ALSO ASSISTS CENTERS IN THEIR COMMUNICATIONS EFFORTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PERMANENT ENDOWMENT FUNDS CONSIST OF A CHARITABLE REMAINDER UNIT TRUST. THESE FUNDS HAVE BEEN RESTRICTED BY THE DONOR TO PROVIDE INCOME TO FURTHER THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE UPON THE DEATH OF THE DONOR. THESE FUNDS ARE ADMINISTERED BY AN UNRELATED PARTY AND PER THE TERMS OF THE DONOR AGREEMENT, NO PART OF THESE FUNDS MAY BE USED UNTIL THAT TIME.

APPLESEED BELIEVES THAT IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OR THAT WOULD HAVE AN EFFECT ON ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. THERE ARE NO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS OR LIABILITIES THAT NEED TO BE RECORDED.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: NEBRASKA APPLESEED CENTER FOR LAW IN THE PUBLIC INTEREST

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: LOUISIANA APPLESEED CENTER FOR LAW AND JUSTICE

NETOWRKING OPPORTUNITY GRANTS AND FOCUS GROUP - THE JUST TRUST
NETOWRKING OPPORTUNITY GRANTS AND FOCUS GROUP - THE JUST TRUST

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE APPLESEED FOUNDATION OCCASIONALLY PROVIDES FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO NEW AND EXISTING APPLESEED JUSTICE CENTERS, WHICH ARE INDEPENDENT 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. FOR NEW APPLESEED JUSTICE CENTERS, THE APPLESEED FOUNDATION PROVIDES FINANCIAL SUPPORT VIA THE NEW CENTER'S FISCAL SPONSOR UNTIL THE NEW CENTER RECEIVES ITS 501(C)(3) DETERMINATION FROM THE IRS. FOR EXISTING CENTERS, THE APPLESEED FOUNDATION REVIEWS GRANT APPLICATION MATERIALS, CONFIRMS THE CENTER'S NONPROFIT STATUS, AND REVIEWS COMPLIANCE WITH ANY GRANT RESTRICTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL MEMBERS OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE WILL BE PROVIDED WITH THE DRAFT OF THE FORM 990 FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE ENTIRE BOARD BEFORE IT IS FINALIZED AND FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH BOARD MEMBER IS ASKED TO FILL OUT A QUESTIONNAIRE REGARDING CONFLICT OF INTEREST ANNUALLY AND TURN IN THE SIGNED FORM TO THE DIRECTOR OF OPERATIONS WHO MAINTAINS A FILE ON THESE DISCLOSURES. IF IT'S FOUND THAT A MEMBER HAS FAILED TO COMPLY WITH THIS POLICY IT MAY RESULT IN FURTHER INVESTIGATION AND THE BOARD MAY TAKE APPROPRIATE ACTION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S BYLAWS, WHICH MAY INCLUDE REMOVAL FROM OFFICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE BASES THE COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR ON COMPENSATION OF DIRECTORS OF ORGANIZATIONS OF SIMILAR SIZES, COMPLEXITY, REGIONS AND SKILLS REQUIRED. WHEN CONSIDERING ANNUAL COMPENSATION LEVEL, THE BOARD ALSO CONSIDERS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S PERFORMANCE AND THE AVERAGE SALARY INCREASE FOR STAFF MEMBERS. CHANGES IN COMPENSATION ARE FIRST DISCUSSED AT THE EXECUTIVE COMMITEE LEVEL AND ARE THEN VOTED ON BY THE FULL BOARD IN AN EXECUTIVE SESSION OF THE BOARD MEETING. THE LAST COMPENSATION REVIEW TOOK PLACE IN DECEMBER 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL POLICIES ARE EITHER A PART OF THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS OR PART OF THE EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK AND CAN BE OBTAINED BY A WRITTEN REQUEST TO THE ORGANIZATION.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS NOT CHANGED ITS AUDIT OVERSIGHT OR SELECTION PROCESS DURING THE YEAR.
